snippet: Authorities on Tuesday made public the largest antiquities seizure in American history and said their goal is to return the stolen objects to India and their other countries of origin.
abstract: Manhattan district attorney’s office asks New York State Supreme Court for custody of 2,622 artifacts, valued at $107.6, million that have been recovered from city storage facilities of art dealer Subhash Kapoor, who is awaiting trial in India on charges related to archaeological looting and smuggling; prosecutors hope to begin process of returning stolen items to India and to prosecute Kapoor in United States.
lead_paragraph: Authorities on Tuesday made public the largest antiquities seizure in American history and said their goal is to return the stolen objects to India and their other countries of origin.

headline.main: New York Authorities Seek Custody of Stolen Artifacts Worth Over $100 Million
headline.print_headline: Authorities Seek Custody of Stolen Artifacts Worth Over $100 Million
